message.content:
cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.SC 

This paper discusses divergence problems in extrapolation operators for weakly-relational numeric domains, which are commonly used in program analysis and verification. The paper focuses on identifying the cause of the divergences and proposing solutions to avoid resorting to more concrete, syntactic domains. This topic is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including programming languages (cs.PL), logic (cs.LO), software engineering (cs.SE), formal methods (cs.FL), and scientific computing (cs.SC).
